Q1: Who is Dana Blankstein Cohen?
A1: Dana Blankstein Cohen is the executive director of the Sam Spiegel Film and Television School.

Q2: When was Dana Blankstein born?
A2: Dana Blankstein was born on March 3, 1981.

Q3: Where did Dana Blankstein grow up?
A3: Dana Blankstein grew up in Tel Aviv, Israel.

Q4: What is Dana Blankstein's educational background?
A4: Dana Blankstein graduated from the Sam Spiegel Film and Television School with high honors in 2008.

Q5: What are some of Dana Blankstein's notable film projects?
A5: Some of Dana Blankstein's notable film projects include "Tel Aviviot" (mini-series, director), "Growing Pains" (graduation film, Sam Spiegel, director and screenwriter), and "Camping" (debut film, Sam Spiegel, director and screenwriter).

Q6: What is Dana Blankstein's current position?
A6: Dana Blankstein is the executive director of the Sam Spiegel Film and Television School.

Q7: When was Dana Blankstein appointed to her current position?
A7: Dana Blankstein was appointed as the executive director of the Sam Spiegel Film and Television School in November 2019.

Q8: What is the focus of Dana Blankstein's work at the Sam Spiegel Film and Television School?
A8: At the Sam Spiegel Film and Television School, Dana Blankstein oversees the school's film and television programs and spearheaded the launch of the new Series Lab and the film preparatory program for Arabic speakers in east Jerusalem.

Q9: What is Dana Blankstein's background in filmmaking?
A9: Dana Blankstein has a background in filmmaking, having directed and shot several films, including "Growing Pains" and "Camping."

Q10: How has Dana Blankstein contributed to the Israeli film industry?
A10: Dana Blankstein has contributed to the Israeli film industry through her work as a film director, producer, and educator. She has also been involved in promoting cultural projects and educational community activities.

Q1: What is Michael Govan's current position?
A1: Michael Govan is the director of the Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA).

Q2: Where was Michael Govan born?
A2: Michael Govan was born in North Adams, Massachusetts.

Q3: What was Michael Govan's previous position before joining LACMA?
A3: Before joining LACMA, Michael Govan was the president and director of the Dia Art Foundation in New York City.

Q4: How did Michael Govan come to be recruited by LACMA?
A4: A search committee composed of eleven LACMA trustees, led by the late Nancy M. Daly, recruited Michael Govan to run the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

Q5: What is the name of the new building project that Michael Govan is currently working on?
A5: The new building project that Michael Govan is currently working on is called the Zumthor Project, which will replace four of the campus's aging buildings with a single new state-of-the-art gallery building designed by architect Peter Zumthor.

Q6: How much has Michael Govan raised for LACMA so far?
A6: As of January 2017, Michael Govan had raised about $300 million in commitments for the Zumthor Project.

Q7: What is the proposed plan for the collection at LACMA under Michael Govan's leadership?
A7: The proposed plan for the collection at LACMA under Michael Govan's leadership is to merge all existing curatorial departments and departmental collections into a non-departmental art museum.

Q8: What is the current value of the Ahmanson Foundation's support for LACMA?
A8: The Ahmanson Foundation withdrew its support from LACMA after the foundation realized that its acquisitions could no longer be displayed due to the proposed merging of the separate curatorial divisions.

Q9: How does Christopher Knight describe the first exhibition under the new scheme at LACMA?
A9: Christopher Knight describes the first exhibition under the new scheme at LACMA, titled "To Rome and Back," as "bland and ineffectual" and an "unsuccessful sample of what's to come."

Q10: What is Michael Govan's personal life like?
A10: Michael Govan is married and has two daughters, one from a previous marriage. He and his family used to live in a $6 million mansion provided by LACMA but now lives in a trailer park in Malibu's Point Dume region.

Q1: What is Peter Levin's profession?
A1: Peter Levin is a director of film, television, and theatre.

Q2: How many credits has Levin accumulated in episodic television and television films since 1967?
A2: Levin has amassed a large number of credits directing episodic television and television films since 1967.

Q3: Can you name some of the television series credits for which Levin has directed episodes?
A3: Some of the television series credits that Levin has directed episodes for include "Love Is a Many Splendored Thing," "James at 15," "The Paper Chase," "Family," "Starsky & Hutch," "Lou Grant," "Fame," "Cagney & Lacey," and "Law & Order."

Q4: What is the name of the television film that Levin directed for which his wife Audrey Davis Levin received an Emmy?
A4: The television film that Levin directed for which his wife Audrey Davis Levin received an Emmy is titled "[The Diary of Ann Frank]."

Q5: What was Levin's profession before he became a director?
A5: Before becoming a director, Levin worked as an actor in several Broadway productions.

Q6: Can you name some of the theatres where Levin has directed productions?
A6: Some of the theatres where Levin has directed productions include the Long Wharf Theatre and the Pacific Resident Theatre Company.

Q7: What is the name of the off-off-Broadway theatre that Levin co-founded with his wife Audrey Davis Levin?
A7: The off-off-Broadway theatre that Levin co-founded with his wife Audrey Davis Levin is called the Hardware Poets Playhouse.

Q8: Is Levin an associate artist of any theatre company?
A8: Yes, Levin is an associate artist of The Interact Theatre Company.

Q9: How did Levin's military service affect his acting career?
A9: Levin was drafted into the Army during his time as an actor in Broadway productions, which forced him to leave the production of "[The Diary of Ann Frank]."

Q10: Did Levin receive any formal training in directing?
A10: Yes, Levin trained at the Carnegie Mellon University.
